senses.sense_definition: The act of changing something from one form, use, or system to another, or the process of changing one's religion or beliefs.

examples.text: The <w>conversion</w> of the garage into a bedroom was expensive but worth it.
Her sudden <w>conversion</w> to Islam surprised her entire family.

senses.sense_definition: A room or apartment created by rebuilding or altering part of an existing building, such as a loft or warehouse, into living space.

examples.text: They bought a stylish barn <w>conversion</w> in the countryside.
A loft <w>conversion</w> can significantly increase the value of your property.

senses.sense_definition: A marketing metric that counts when a visitor to a website completes a desired goal, such as making a purchase or signing up.

examples.text: We need to improve the landing page to boost our <w>conversion</w> rate.
The new advertising campaign resulted in a high <w>conversion</w> of clicks to sales.

senses.sense_definition: A score made after a try or touchdown by kicking the ball over the crossbar, adding extra points to the team's total.

examples.text: The team lost the game by two points because the kicker missed the <w>conversion</w>.
After scoring the try, he lined up to take the <w>conversion</w> kick.

senses.sense_definition: The unauthorized act of taking or controlling someone else's personal property, depriving the owner of its use.

examples.text: The company sued the former employee for <w>conversion</w> of corporate funds.
Taking the car without permission constituted <w>conversion</w> under the law.

senses.sense_definition: The creation of a new word from an existing one without changing its form, such as using a noun as a verb.

examples.text: In English, <w>conversion</w> allows nouns like "email" to function as verbs.
The word "run" is a classic example of <w>conversion</w> between noun and verb forms.

senses.sense_definition: A software product, such as a video game, that has been adapted to work on a different platform or system.

examples.text: The PC <w>conversion</w> of the popular arcade game was a huge success.
This mobile <w>conversion</w> suffers from poor controls compared to the console version.

senses.sense_definition: A chemical reaction in which a substance is transformed into a different product.

examples.text: The <w>conversion</w> of water into steam requires a significant amount of heat energy.
Catalysts are used to speed up the <w>conversion</w> of raw materials into useful chemicals.

senses.sense_definition: The process of changing a quantity or expression from one unit or form to another without changing its value.

examples.text: The student practiced the <w>conversion</w> of fractions to decimals.
You need a formula for the <w>conversion</w> of miles to kilometers.

senses.sense_definition: The act of reversing the subject and predicate in a logical proposition.

examples.text: Simple <w>conversion</w> is not always a valid method in formal logic.
The professor explained the rules of logical <w>conversion</w> to the class.

senses.sense_definition: The modification of a model figure to create a unique character or pose.

examples.text: He won a prize for his custom <w>conversion</w> of the tank model.
This figure is a simple <w>conversion</w> using parts from two different kits.

senses.sense_definition: The act of turning around or rotating.

examples.text: The ancient text describes the <w>conversion</w> of the celestial spheres.
One full <w>conversion</w> of the wheel takes approximately five seconds.
